name: Toronto Metropolitan University Concert Choir presents Gloria: A Winter Celebration
description:
Enjoy a joyful evening of choral music that welcomes the warmth and light of the season. 

The program features Vivaldi's Gloria, works by Handel and pieces by international and female composers, alongside Hanukkah and solstice songs and a traditional Catalan carol.

name: Tasty Tours Holiday Chocolate Express
description:
Step into the magic of the season aboard our Holiday Chocolate Express, a decadent chocolate tasting inside a vintage train car! 

As rich aromas fill the air, your chocolate expert will teach you how to savor each creation and uncover the fascinating stories behind them. You'll leave with your own tasting tools, extra chocolate to share, and a heart full of holiday spirit. Celebrate the warmth and wonder of the holidays, from Christmas to Hanukkah and everything joyful in between, with this once-a-year experience that blends nostalgia, indulgence, and delight.

Note that this event focuses on the darker spectrum of chocolate and is best for those who appreciate quality dark chocolate or are open to broadening their horizons beyond the standard supermarket brands like Lindt and Nestle!

name: 16 CHAIRS Vocal Ensemble
description:
A newly founded community-based women's group in Riverdale born of a shared desire to explore a wide range of repertoire at the highest level, the ensemble has taken shape over just four and a half months. Under the Music Direction of Geoff Butler, piano accompanist William O'Meare and Artistic Director Donna Green, sixteen talented singers have come together to present a one-hour Christmas program including Ceremony of Carols by Benjamin Britten.

Join us at Hugh's Room, to welcome the season by celebrating this inaugural performance.

name: Breakfast with Santa
description:
Celebrate the magic of the season! 

Families are invited to enjoy a festive morning filled with holiday cheer, complete with a gourmet breakfast buffet, story time with Mrs. Claus, and creative seasonal crafts. 

Guests will have the chance to meet Santa in a beautiful venue overlooking Toronto's waterfront, where each child will receive a special keepsake gift to take home.

name: Academy Chamber Orchestra

location.name: Mazzoleni Concert Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description: String students from The Phil and Eli Taylor Performance Academy for Young Artists come together as the Academy Chamber Orchestra to perform a special concert.

name: A Tribute to King Crimson
description:
Paying tribute to the legendary, influential British rock band King Crimson.

Corey Ryan and friends will be playing their very first album "In the Court of the Crimson King", in its entirety as well as a bunch of classics from the 70s and 80s.

Their first album is revolutionary in its fusion of rock with jazz, classical, and avant-garde elements, laying the groundwork for the entire progressive rock genre.

The band is comprised of some of Torontos finest musicians; Forest Hope, Celeste Van Winkle, Victor Xu, Alex Percel, Alex Fuchs, Spencer Bridgwater, Riley Maguire, Lazar Miric, and Corey Ryan.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Gibson House
description:
Beginning December 13 at Gibson House, discover the vibrant voices of eighteen young Toronto artists under the mentorship of the inPrint Collective. The youth artists are interpreting the idea of home through relief printing.

Celebrate the creativity, passion and stories of youth in a series of eight inspiring installations across the city at Toronto History Museum sites. These installations are produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Montgomery's Inn
description:
Discover the vibrant voices of 10 young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Chelsea Laria. See how youth artists explore the meanings and stories 'between the lines' through poetry, photography, and audio. 

Join Toronto History Museums in celebrating the creativity, passion and stories of youth in a series of eight inspiring installations across the city. These installations are produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: Loreena McKennitt: Under A Winter's Moon I

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Celebrate the holiday season with Juno Award-winning artist Loreena McKennitt and her enchanting Under A Winter's Moon concert, a live performance of carols and tales blends Celtic, Indigenous, and Welsh cultures.

The show also includes Gemini Award-winning actor Cedric Smith narrating the magical A Child's Christmas in Wales and begins with Ojibway artist Christin Dennis, also known as Gzhiiquot/Fast Moving Cloud, presenting the story of Skywoman. Prepare to be transported to a world of music and spoken word that connects with our past and awakens the spirit of the season.

Loreena McKennitt's eclectic Celtic blend of pop, folk, and world music has sold over 14 million albums worldwide. Her recordings have achieved Gold, Platinum, and multi-Platinum status in 15 countries on four continents. In 2004, McKennitt was awarded the Order of Canada and in 2013 was appointed Knight of the National Order of Arts and Letters of the Republic of France.

name: Jake Lambert's The Sunshine Kid Tour

location.name: The Randolph Theatre (at the Randolph College of the Performing Arts)

description:
One of the UK's most exciting new comedians—is heading to Canada with his smash-hit show!

Described by The Telegraph as "a joke machine," Jake Lambert's non-stop gag-filled storytelling has made him one of the fastest-rising names in comedy. The Sunshine Kid sees Jake hilariously navigate the quirks of everyday life, his fear of being "normal," and the all-too-familiar urge to ask strangers what breed their dogs are. Jake's spot-on, viral online videos have amassed more than 500 million views and earned him over 650,000 Instagram followers. He has supported comedy superstar Michael McIntyre on his worldwide tour and appeared on Live At The Apollo, Comedy Central, and Dave.

As a writer, Jake has contributed to many of the UK's top comedy shows, including The Royal Variety Performance, Michael McIntyre's Big Show, Bake Off, and 8 Out of 10 Cats. His 2022 Edinburgh Fringe show Liminal was one of the best-reviewed shows of the festival.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Scarborough Museum
description:
Beginning December 13th at Scarborough Museum, discover the vibrant voices of twenty-two young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Anthony Gebrehiwot and Keunsu Cho. Through the mediums of photography and fashion design, Scarborough Museum's cohort examine the many meanings of "home."

Anthony Gebrehiwot is a multiple award winning visual artist, photographer and community leader whose creative lens re-visions photography as an ongoing dialogue of social change between subject and society. Keunsu Cho is a multidisciplinary fashion designer and researcher creating storytelling-based artworks and protective designs inspired by resilience and social advocacy.

Celebrate the creativity, passion and stories of youth in a series of eight inspiring installations across the city at Toronto History Museum sites. These installations are produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: Toronto Queer Market
description:
The Toronto Queer happens once a month year round, make sure you drop by for the holiday edition that includes a FREE drag show at 2:30pm.
We cannot wait to see you all!

name: Marc Decho's Bom Comeco
description: New original Afro-Brazilian jazz works and tunes by Marcos Valle, Jobim and master Hermeto Pascoal.

name: Toronto Wrestling Club: Deck The Halls
description:
Join us for the most wonderful time of the year! 

Enjoy a fun and action packed festivity that only professional wrestling can offer. Witness both rising stars and local legends from around Toronto compete in the squared circle. Henderson's will be serving up all your favourite beer, including a variety of other drinks and food.

Secure your tickets now!

Please note that this is a standing room only event.

name: An Evening of Musical Mantras: Holiday Edition
description:
It's the holidays! We're excited to invite you for a special seasonal evening of interactive musical mantra meditation (kirtan).

Kirtan is a call-and-response form of meditation, utilizing ancient eastern mantras, traditional instruments and our very own voices. The event will present an opportunity to explore your sacred heart space through the power of music and mantras. The practice of kirtan can tap into deep states of consciousness but can also invoke exciting feelings of joy and energy.

Presenting this special workshop will be members of the Kirtan Culture Initiative who have been sharing kirtan in various capacities throughout Toronto for close to 15 years. We warmly invite you to join us!

name: Little Jamaica Gran' Market

location.name: Green P Parking Lot at Oakwood & Eglinton

description:
Experience the vibrant spirit of Gran'Market in Little Jamaica! 

This event brings the tradition of Jamaica's festive street markets—a hub for food, crafts, music, and holiday joy—honoring a legacy that has shaped Jamaican Christmas culture for generations. Enjoy local vendors, live performances, and community activities throughout the evening. 

Let's Light up Little Jamaica together.

name: The Woodshed Orchestra
description:
We exist to uplift people. Listen to our mash up classic dance styles from all over the world and watch us turn them into a soulful celebration. 

Iconoclastic Toronto drummer Dave Clark (Rheostatics, Charles Spearin, Dinner is Ruined, Gord Downie…) created The Woodshed Orchestra with passionate, courageous and joyful friends to play the music from his original songbook. 

Clark leads the band "Levon Helm-style" from the drumkit, singing and sharing the lead vocal duties with members of the band. The band is a powerhouse that can improvise and turn tunes around on a dime to create unique frenzied moments that leave audiences awestruck and excited. 

The Woodshed Orchestra can play out as an electric band with drums, guitars, horns, keyboards and vocals and just as easily break out into a New Orleans-type 2nd Line brass band on parade. They plays with all the love that they have in their hearts every time they take the stage. It's a beautiful thing.

name: Loohoo Weird Holiday Market
description:
Weird Holiday Market at Loohoo! Dec 13–14, 11am–6pm. Quirky gifts, funky art, and holiday mischief for the festive misfits!
Join us for a weekend of quirky, festive fun!

From hand-carved sculptures to kinky gifts, whimsical prints, magical candles, kitschy ceramics, and everything in between — our vendors have the perfect weird & wonderful gifts for your favorite misfits, lovers, and friends

Come explore, shop, and celebrate the holidays in style — all while supporting local artists, makers, and creators!
@natureboythings | @camiblooms | @kinkytaxi | @tobiasjayart | @sick.stories | @olivia.sementsova | @junijuni.studio | @soygirldesigns | @dripteasewaxplay | @crowecarving | @sucresna

Two levels of cutness and, weird holiday charm:
⬆️ Upstairs: Loohoo (your cozy gift shop full of delight) plus a few festive vendors
⬇️ Downstairs: The majority of the Weird Holiday Market vendors offering handmade gifts + art!

name: Demetrios Petsalakis Trio
description:
Originally from Athens Greece, Demetri Petsalakis performs in a variety of styles with a focus on Greek and Middle Eastern lutes. 

Influenced by the rich cultural diversity of Canada, Demetri incorporates musical elements from different traditions in order to create a contemporary sound that represents both his heritage and the community that he is a part of. 

An active member of the Toronto world music scene Demetri has recorded and performed with groups including Kune, Tafelmusik, Ventanas, Near East Trio, Zephyr, Turkwaz, Moneka Arabic Jazz and Moskitto Bar.

name: FROSTLINE: Techno and Tech-House Rave
description:
Toronto's coldest techno party of the season. Techno, tech-house, strobe lights, and a warehouse vibe all night long.

Step into a high-energy night built around underground sounds, cold visuals, and a gritty, Berlin-inspired vibe.

Samm Du and Shaingel will be on deck, delivering a deep, driving mix of techno, tech-house and a touch of drum and bass to keep the floor moving from start to finish.

If you're looking for an intimate party with serious atmosphere, heavy beats and a community-driven crowd, this is it.

name: Hollywood Jade Presents: The Naughty List, a Holiday Cabaret

location.name: The Fleck at Harbourfront Centre Theatre

description:
Enjoy a sizzling night of holiday classics reimagined with an urban burlesque twist. 

Step into Hollywood's world of glamour, grit and unapologetic celebration, where rhythm meets risqué and every move could land you on Santa's naughty list. 

Featuring powerhouse performers from Urbanesque and Gents Slay Quoi, plus a show-stopping headliner: Canada's Drag Race Season 5 Winner, The Virgo Queen, and very special guests. 

Grab yourself a cocktail and get ready for a holiday spectacle that is bold, breathtaking and beautifully naughty.

Enjoy a pre-show demonstration exploring the power of the reveal. Under the playful guidance of burlesque performer, Petra Liyahn, you'll discover how a simple gesture can become an irresistible invitation. Learn how simple movements, with props like boas, gloves and fans  can unlock the art of seduction one movement at a time.

name: Beverly Glenn-Copeland with special guest Elizabeth Copeland
description:
Bringing an evening of deep resonance, where music, language, and spirit converge toward healing and connection. 

Glenn, the visionary singer, songwriter, and composer, alongside Elizabeth, the celebrated author, theatre artist, and educator, in a collaborative performance exploring creativity as a force for collective renewal. Glenn's "The One Ahead", his first new album in nearly two decades, channels joyful gratitude and the unyielding pulse of life. Together, they shape a shared practice of song and story where community itself becomes the art form. 

Opening and closing the show we have Kamra and Topanga Trio, respectively.

organizer.name: Venus Fest, Burn Down the Capital, ThMusic Gallery

name: Vivaldi's Gloria: A Winter Celebration
description:
Step into the warmth of the season with an evening of radiant choral music. Powerful voices and festive harmonies come together in a program that spans centuries of musical tradition.

Experience the brilliance of Vivaldi's Gloria and the elegance of Handel, alongside pieces by international and female composers. The program also features songs that reflect the season's diverse traditions, from Hanukkah and Solstice melodies to a beloved Catalan carol. Share in the choral spirit and join the many sing-alongs throughout the evening.
